Literature Review: The COVID-19 pandemic has had a profound impact on carceral systems worldwide, with significant consequences for the health and well-being of incarcerated individuals, correctional officers, and surrounding communities. This review aims to provide an overview of the existing literature on the intersection of COVID-19, prisons, and jails, with a focus on health outcomes, prevention and mitigation efforts, and areas for future research.
